subject: Fond Memories of Spain
event: One thing I'm really really bad at is writing trip reports. I always have good intentions, especially when headed overseas, but whenever I get back from a long trip I find myself buried in emails, bills, snail mail, deadlines, and other pressing matters, and by the time I dig myself out from under it's time to get back to work. I was sorting through some of my photos this evening, however, and I came across some pictures from our visit to Spain in 2008 that brought back some wonderful memories. The Spanish fans were really amazing, and the annual summer literary festival in Gijon, Semana Negra, is like no other event I've ever been to. If you ever get a chance to attend, do. Parris and I have been twice now, and I expect we'll be back again someday. Meanwhile, although it's way too late to write a trip report, I thought I would share some of the pictures with you guys. Here's a panel from Semana Negra. Me and Scott Bakker and Diego, the most amazing translator. This was from a party that the Spanish fans threw for me in Gijon. Many of them were in costume. Herewith me and a mass o' Melisandres. And here's Parris with the men of the Night's Watch: Some of the men of the Night's Watch were actually women, of course. (Damn, why didn't I think to make Jon Snow a really cute girl?) This one breaks my heart. It's me with the specially engraved sword that was presented to me by the members of the fan group Asshai. Alas, this was one of the swords that was stolen when my office was burglarized last year. Since it's engraved to me, I actually hoped the cops might be able to recover it, but of course not. If anyone ever sees a sword like this in a flea market or pawn shop... well, it won't be hard to recognize with the engraving... There's lots more fond memories that I don't have pictures for... but Spain is an amazing place, and we WILL be back one day. (Portugal was great as well. I'll post those pictures next).

comments.article:
Thank you for the wonderful pictures. Somehow I feel that A Song of Ice and Fire would not be the same with Jenny Snow...

I'm sorry to 'hear' that your sword got stolen.
Semana Negra is awesome (not that i'm from Gijon or anything...) XD
I would miss that sword, too :(
That sword is amazing and beautiful... I hope it returns to you.
That is one gorgeous sword. If they ever find the thieves, stick 'em with the pointy end.

comments.upictitle: Nuchtchas (Nutty, NIMLAS, however you know me): comic me
comments.article: you normally I don't read these comments or even comment, but corbie those words were just too fitting and made me laugh :)

I am just the same about travel logs.. and project logs.. and meeting logs... and well I don't think we're alone on that one!!

Here, I think you've done a great job. In fact its rather comprehensive, I'd say - going on the premise that a picture paints a thousand words, I'd have to say 'that travel report you did on Spain was a bit wordy George...you aught to cut it down a bit!'

LOL. The photos are gorgeous, I only wish I got to be there in person. :D

Phipps tells me you are working your fingers to the bone at the moment, spending your days in Westeros.. again I wish I was their in person (well as a fly on the wall or as a man maybe!).

Anyway: Your Brilliant. We love you. Keep up the Great Works.
Big Hugs (..another case where .. the in person thing would be much cooler..)
comments.subject: Travel logs

comments.upictitle: You'll have to speak up, I'm wearing a towel: borat
comments.article: Daaamn, look at all those Melisandres. Enough to make poor Davos wet his breeches!
Semana negra is awesome (not that i'm from Gijón or anything... xD)
We will all now be looking out for that sword, woe betide those who stole it from you.
comments.subject: Sword

comments.article:
It's great to know you enjoyed your visit to Spain as much as we who were lucky to see you were.
Hope you can manage to visit Barcelona again soon and maybe read some extracts of the book??? Maybe asking too much, hoping to see you back soon.
comments.subject: Hoping you can make it to Barcelona

comments.article:
Nice to hear it, George!
when are you coming back? I´m sure you would like Toledo, it resembles Westeros cities, and there are many, many swords!
I'll never forgive <s>my parents</s> myself for not having went, when I live like, half an hour from there.

I wasn't a fan of yours back in 2008, but I promise I'll travel wherever you visit us in Spain next time! What about the Barcelona Comic Con, Salò del Cómic? Last year, the people in your spanish publisher's stand wore a t-shirt that read: "No, we don't know when "A Dance of Dragons will be out". And, in the back: "Have you read "Dying of the light"?". We'd love to see you there. I could even disguise as UnCat out of enthusiasm...
comments.subject: Come back!

comments.article: I haven't been in Gijon but that convention seems really good and i hope you attend it again so the newish fans can go and see you there. Awesome sword by the way, maybe you could get a similar one in Toledo, a part of Spain famous for the sword-blades made there
Great i wish you visit our country when dance with dragons get publicate here... don´t forgett to visit Madrid and Seville.

comments.upictitle: Proud to be a geek.  Proud to be a gentleman.: data-wtf
comments.article:
What an amazing time! You are a lucky man, sir, to be living such a wonderful life. (Well, okay, you DID earn it. ;) )

In any case, my particular favorite is that picture of The Night Watch! Melisandre's notwithstanding :P
that's awfully sad about your sword.  it was beautiful.

comments.upictitle: scholarinexile: Tomorrowland in Walt Disney World
comments.article: I spent a summer in Spain doing archaeology north of Burgos about six years ago, and I concur- it's an amazing country, and I miss it terribly. And I sympathize with the loss of your blade- Spanish steel is like none other. The dagger I got in Toledo is the prize piece in my collection.

The bastard who stole that sword deserves to have chopped his head off with it. Or have Tyrion sneaking up at him with something sharp and pointy. :)

I'm afraid the police won't bother - and probably indeed doesn't have the time as they told me - to hunt down stolen objects. They make a list in case they happen to come across something by chance, but the material part is business of the insurance, and the memories .... I never got my mother's brooch back; it's probably been sold on some black market in Poland.

comments.upictitle: Miranda: not enough time to read
comments.article: Aw that is an awesome sword, I hope you find it!!

Hi Mr Martin, it's my first time leaving a comment on your no a blog, of course I'm very exciting about the show, we met on Madrid on the sign event and talked about that (I was the timid guy with the american Feast for Crows tome).

Well I alway wanted to nkow if the people from Gilgamesh let you taste our food, spanish people are very proud about our home made cooking (my spanish omelete is the best in the world :P) and well you should have every day our tasty and healthy food, we want Martin for so many years.
comments.subject: Spanish Food

comments.article: They, george and parris, were eating in my restaurant and I have the hope that they remember it for when they return to come to barcelona. I believe that they remained very satisfied with the Spanish food
comments.subject: Re: Spanish Food

comments.article: The picture of you with the engraved sword is so bittersweet as I can tell how pleased you are holding it, but now knowing the fact that you no longer have it is disheartening. :(

OMG, that's me! I'm the Feminine Side of Jon Snow xD
I'm very happy, you remember us! Come back to Spain soon, we miss you and Parris!

I'm sorry for the sword, it was really beautiful =(

We have a surprise for you. We expect send it to you in the next weeks =)

Farewell!
You ALWAYS will be welcome...

comments.upictitle: al_zorra: white kitsune under white moon
comments.article:
A Spanish sword -- no wonder your heart was broken.

love, C.
